question_text: Find the integer $n,$ $-90 < n < 90,$ such that $\tan n^\circ = \tan 312^\circ.$
response:
We know that $\tan$ is an odd function and has a period of $180^\circ$, which means that
$\tan (x^\circ) = \tan ((x^\circ + k\cdot 180)^\circ).$
Substituting, we have that
$\tan n^\circ = \tan (312^\circ)$
$\Leftrightarrow$ $\tan n^\circ = \tan ((312-2\cdot 180)^\circ)= \tan(52^\circ).$
We conclude $n=52.$
